column3: This is silly, but the new name `hash256_reversed` scared me for a split second - my first association was hash inversion.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16404](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16404.html) (qa: Test ZMQ notification after chain reorg

wouldn't mind being extra verbose here, since it is only used twice in the code

```suggestion
def hash256_reversed(byte_str):
```
Or maybe just move it to the zmq test, as that is the only place where it is used
Looks like you can replace all of this code with `hash256()[::-1]`

yeah but then there will be a circular dependencies. (messages already imports util, this will require util to also import messages)\n\nBut if I'll move this function to zmq tests then that's possible(or to messages?)
